Isochronous Resource Management (IRM)
[Core Modules]

Detailed Description

This module implements functions to manage isochronous channels and bandwidth.

This module can be used from the command prompt by the cli_irm commands.


Functions

 Allocates the specified number of bandwidth units.

Function Documentation

HRESULT irmAllocateSpecifiedChannel (  uint32 *  channel  ) 
 

Allocates the specified channel.

If channel == IRM_ANY_AVAIL_ISOCH_CHANNEL, the next available channel will be allocated.

Parameters:
channel The address of the location containing the channel to allocate. If channel == IRM_ANY_AVAIL_ISOCH_CHANNEL, this location will be updated with the actual channel allocated.
Returns:
NO_ERROR (0) or an error code

HRESULT irmAllocateNextAvailableChannel (  uint32 *  channel  ) 
 

Allocates the next available channel.

Parameters:
channel The address of the location that will be updated with the actual channel allocated.
Returns:
NO_ERROR (0) or an error code

HRESULT irmFindChannelAvailable (  uint32 *  channel  ) 
 

Finds an available channel.

Parameters:
channel The address to place the available channel in.
Returns:
NO_ERROR (0) or an error code

_TC_INLINE HRESULT irmAllocateChannel (  uint32  channel  ) 
 

Allocates the specified channel.

Parameters:
channel The isochronous channel to allocate.
Returns:
NO_ERROR (0) or an error code

_TC_INLINE HRESULT irmFreeChannel (  uint32  channel  ) 
 

Frees the specified channel.

Parameters:
channel The isochronous channel to free.
Returns:
NO_ERROR (0) or an error code

_TC_INLINE HRESULT irmAllocateBandwidth (  uint32  bwu  ) 
 

Allocates the specified number of bandwidth units.

Parameters:
bwu The number of bandwidth units to allocate.
Returns:
NO_ERROR (0) or an error code

_TC_INLINE HRESULT irmFreeBandwidth (  uint32  bwu  ) 
 

Frees the specified number of bandwidth units.

Parameters:
bwu The number of bandwidth units to free.
Returns:
NO_ERROR (0) or an error code

HRESULT irmGetBMNodeId (  uint32 *  nodeId  ) 
 

Obtain the node ID of the Bus Manager.

Parameters:
nodeId The address to place the node ID of the bus manager node in.
Returns:
NO_ERROR (0) or an error code

HRESULT irmGetCMNodeId (  uint32 *  nodeId  ) 
 

Obtain the node ID of the Cycle Master.

Parameters:
nodeId The address to place the node ID of the Cycle Master node in.
Returns:
NO_ERROR (0) or an error code

HRESULT irmGetIRMNodeId (  uint32 *  nodeId  ) 
 

Obtain the node ID of the Isochronous Resource Manager.

Parameters:
nodeId The address to place the node ID of the Isochronous Resource Manager node in.
Returns:
NO_ERROR (0) or an error code

Initialization of this module.
